poem:
Title: The Smoke of Distant Fires

Above the bright line of dawn, smoke rises,
From far-off lands where evening still resides.
Ten echoes lost in stark reprisal,
And silent voices shaking the tides.
Bitter law on tongues unsummoned,
In Georgian streets where tempers hide.
Call it not Russian nor outsiders' guise,
But the roar of discontent, nation-wild.
Oh, heartache's script, inked in crimson,
A somber tale of humanity defiled.
